lines.text: May God grant us the wisdom to discover right, the will to choose it, and the strength to make it endure.
There's a peace only to be found on the other side of war. If that war should come I will fight it!
God uses people like you, Lancelot. Because your heart is open. You hold nothing back. You give all of yourself.
If you knew me better, you would not say such things.
Oh, hey, I take the good with the bad, together. I can't love people in slices.
Lancelot, just a thought. A man who fears nothing is a man who loves nothing; and if you love nothing, what joy is there in your life? I may be wrong.
Only a fool wants what he can not have.

I have no pride left in me. What I do, now I do for my people and for Camelot. And may they forgive me. This is my last act as your king. Do not be afraid. All things change. I am Arthur of Camelot, and I command you now... all... To fight! Fight like you've never fought before! Never surrender! Never Surrender! Fight as you never...
[Arthur is shot by several crossbow bolts]
Camelot lives!
For the first in my life, I wanted what all wise man say can't last; what can't be promised or made to linger any more than sunlight. I don't want to die without having felt its warmth on my face.
What we hold to be right, and good, and true IS right and good and true for all men. Otherwise we're just another robber tribe.
Love has many faces. I may look on you differently, but not with less love.
You must not care whether you live or die.
I dare not kiss so lovely a lady. I have but one heart to lose.
You risked your life for another. There is no greater love.
Self-sacrifice is very easy. It's having to sacrifice someone you love that puts your convictions to the test.
There are laws that enslave men, and laws that set them free.

This is the heart of Camelot, not these stones, not these timbers, these palaces and towers. Burn them all and Camelot lives on, because it lives in us. Camelot is a belief that we hold in our hearts.
Do you know how to win a sword fight?
How?
Be the only one with a sword!
What I offer you is freedom; freedom from Arthur's tyrannical dream; fredom from Arthur's tyrannical law; freedom from Arthur's tyrannical God.
If there is any honor in you, promise me never to do that again.
I don't know about honor. But I promise you, I won't kiss you again till you ask me to.
I want to marry you. Not your crown, not your army. Just you.
How have I failed you?
I've never believed in anything before. But I do believe in Camelot, and I would serve it best by leaving.
I trusted you, loved you, and you betrayed me!
I never meant to hurt you, my lord.
You leave me nothing! Nothing!

[to Lancelot after being betrayed]
The law will judge you!
I only know one way to love my lord, and that is body and mind and soul.
What wise men say doesn't last. What cannot be promised, or made to linger any more than sunlight.
The great Arthur and his great dream. No dream lasts forever.
